fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48340].
  {panel}

Guys...the tagging system is all but broken.  Go back to something you know works.  There are so many tags now in your test platform that when I try to type one in my browser locks up for about 5 minutes.

Yes, I can select one of the existing ones presented as suggestions...

But...it's horrible.  Definitely not ready for prime time.

By the way, I tried to type 1.0.655 for the version number, but it doesn't exist in your "effected versions" list.  Are you guys not following your own deployment methodologies?  Not good.
fields.summary: Tagging system is broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48320].
  {panel}

Every now and then, users complain that no email is going out of Confluence + Questions.  

Restarting it seems to clear the backlog and we don't seem to lose any emails, but I cannot for the life of me find out why it's happening.  The mail server reports no email incoming.  Confluence logging shows no errors around the email even in debug mode, it's like Confluence has simply decided not to even try to send the mail.  I don't know where to look in Confluence to debug this.

Are there any pointers as to where to look on this?

Actually, Atlassian Answers is in this state at the moment - no emails have arrived from it for days now.
fields.summary: Email stops, unable to work out why
stats display / wrapping

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48317].
  {panel}

Hi, 

I was pointing out this already someday in Answers that it would be great to have a "personalized" activity stream. The activity that only show changes to the questions where we contributed. (we added a comment/answer, our questions, .. )

This could be very helpful to catch up with updated after last log in and not forget about any important comment. 

Currently the only way is to check email to know if there was a reply to the question or answer.. 

Thanks,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48300].
  {panel}

*How to Replicate The Bug*

# Generate a new test question
# Log out and log in using a different user
# Access the new test question generated by the previous user
# Up vote the question multiple times
# Access Mail Queue and click "Flush Mail Queue" button

*Result*

Confluence will generate multiple notification to the users watching the question with the same title, "<User> Upvoted your question".

*Improvement Behaviour*

Confluence should not generate multiple notification with the same title when the action to generate such notification happen in a close proximity of time.
fields.summary: Clicking Upvote Multiple Time on The Same Question/Comment Generating Multiple Notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48281].
  {panel}

It took me awhile about 20 minutes to actually hit the submit button on an answer.   After hitting the submit button the answer displayed, but it showed the time of 21 minutes ago.  You should measure the time from the time of submit and not from the time when I start entering the answer.

To reproduce
1)  start answering a question
2) stop typing for 5 to 10 minutes.
3) finishing type your answer
4) submit

The time on your answer is 5 to 10 minutes old already.
fields.summary: The time shown for when I created an answer is incorrect.
An extra/unneeded space above the Question text.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48278].
  {panel}

We use confluence already for some years and therefore we have quite some FAQ spread across different space. I like the Confluence Question solution but I do have a challenge. Do we either move these FAQ to Confluence Questions or do we keep the FAQ and duplicate the questions into Confluence Questions and put a link to the original wiki page as answer. 

I still like the FAQ in a space because the FAQ is a part of something bigger. But I also like the power of Confluence Questions, the way the community can easily contribute. It would be great if a FAQ in a space could be made available in Confluence Questions without duplication of data. 

I see current different options but there might be others

* A data synchronization between page and answer. 
* Confluence Questions shows the content of wiki page automatically if a wiki link is posted as answer
fields.summary: Reuse confluence page content in a confluence answer without duplicating data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48277].
  {panel}

I attempted to search for keywords "sql server".   I got the dropdown with about 10 answers.   I was not able scroll down to see the last few answers.  
When I moved the cursor to the scroll bar, the dropdown disappeared.

Then when I hit the enter key hoping to see the list of results it took me to the enter question dialog.

I know there are more questions marked with sql server than those ten questions.
fields.summary: How to search by keywords?
Clicking "Ban this user" Button doesn't change anything
Can't add images to Answers
Provide a notification and link to Answer Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48267].
  {panel}

Your idea of a more fancy topic search was on the right track previously,  but it was not easy or very usable as well as confusing.   There was too much ui complexity in it.

The interface of searching through topics should be improved some more. 

There should be a way to search with multiple topics.   Some topics requires additional properties like product topics.  Topics and grouping or topics should be limiting topics.

So if I search by 

sql-server

 I see all questions with this label (like it does now)

If I search by

sql-server jira (which does not work)

I see all questions with these two labels and all questions with sq-server without any product labels.  I should be able to visually see this distinction as well.

if I search by 

configuration sql-server  jira

I would like to see all questions with all questions with
jira configuration sql-server
jira configuration
jira sql-server
configuration (with no product label)
sql-server (with no product label)

Again I should visually see this distinction on how you want to display the results.

I think showing the various grouping of the labels and allowing the user to select or click the groupings he want to look at might be an interesting approach.

Yes, this type of interface breaks down if you have too many topics(labels) but in reality a user will probably enter no more than 4 to 6 labels in the most common cases.  I would not restrict the number either since the interface would only be listing the proper set of combinations and not actually selecting the question themselves.

I like that you are autocompleting the list of topics for a single topic,  there should be a way to do this with multiple topics as well.  Otherwise I would like to see an ordered list of topics that I can browse through and select from.
fields.summary: improve searching by topics
Allow users to export/import the content of Questions plugin
My questions and answers
The answer window is narrow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48261].
  {panel}

I've seen many cases like this and I believe it's a trend, we have a lot of questions that are unanswered in Answers backlog and potentially will never be answered.

I see that most of those questions aren't trivial, which makes me believe that people tend to answer the easy ones and let behind the tough questions. 

Now that we are building the new Answers portal with Confluence questions, I think that it would be a good idea create a system that automatically increase the Karma bounty for questions that are unanswered for a long time.

Of course there are some of those old questions that are not relevant, so we could take in consideration only the questions that have a significant number of watchers of page views for example.
fields.summary: Automatically increase bounty for question

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48235].

My question have more than 100 answers. And now they will be separated by applying the paging (4 answers per page => there're 25 pages).

It's very hard to find (walkthrough all 25 pages to find the best answer). Before applying the paging I often used Cmd+F to find the answer that work for me.

!Screen Shot 2015-04-14 at 9.33.57 AM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48227].
  {panel}

Right now points are rounded up when displaying an user's point information.  I know this was how it was in the old answers, but it portrays false information.

Let say you earn some swag at 1500 points.   Starting at 1450 points the user's point value will show 1.5k and he/she might think they earned their swag until they actually look at their real point value.   

If you displayed 1.5k starting at 1500 through 1599, there would be no misrepresentation.

Is there a reason that 1.5k needs to represent 1450 through 1549 points?
fields.summary: truncate instead of rounding points

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48207].
  {panel}

At the 2014 Summit, a modification of Confluence Questions was seen where you could have "Sessions" which allowed questions to be grouped.  This would be useful for company Q&A sessions, town hall meetings, etc.

https://summit.atlassian.net/wiki/questions/sessions

* Allow the concept of Sessions
* Allow questions to be voted up/down from the question list without having to drill into the question (similar CQ-758)
fields.summary: Productize the Session capabilities that were seen at Summit 2014
The user profile does not update after banning an user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48202].
  {panel}

Hi Sam,

Since Atlassian switched Answers to Questions, I miss the old graph which was always pointing upwards. It was just addictive, it makes you want to participate just for the sake of pushing the cursor upwards. It also displayed your inactivity periods, so you didn't want to look like a slacker and you'd make the effort of answering one or two questions every fortnight. Which is an addiction trigger.

Now it's gone. You might want to check what's user engagement since the transition.

Best of luck Sam,
Adrien
fields.summary: Graphs are addictive and Questions don't have any
Permissions for Questions
Page/Question views
By design, anonymous users will not see questions
Ability to recommend to staff

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48190].
  {panel}

I was wondering if it would be possible to add two more options (beside the existing Popular, Recent (by question creation date), Unanswered, and My Questions):
Recent Activity – In order based on the latest activity (i.e. creation, answer, comment, or edit) instead of creation like Recent
Number of Answers – In order (descending would be best) based on the number of answers. The Unanswered filter is useful for finding questions with 0 answers, but in some cases a question may be truly unanswered even though it has “answers” posted. For example, Paul just responded to many of the unanswered questions with an answer that was just asking if it still needed to be answered. Because of that, these questions no longer show up in the Unanswered filter. We should probably discourage people from doing that, but with this alternate sort order you could look at questions with only 1 “answer”.
An alternative (or in addition) would be to make Unanswered (or a new filter) include any questions without a “selected” answer regardless of how many “answers” have been posted and encourage people to choose a selected answer when their questions are answered. Most people don’t seem to select an answer currently though so this might not be good enough by itself…might still need the Number of Answers option.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48175].
  {panel}

Hi,

I noticed a bug with the question list macro that you can embed in a confluence page. I added a recent questions list with a topic "visual_statistics" on my page and both in the preview as in the page after saving it shows a topic that doesn't have a tag "visual_statistics", but "visual_analytics" (which is a different product).

See screenshots.

Thanks for investigating,

Gianni

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48169].
  {panel}

I lost one comment in this question:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11990086

I'm not 100% sure about steps I performed, but I think it was one of these:

1) I had an answer with a comment. I have converted a second answer to a comment putting it under the first answer. The first comment in the first answer has been deleted.

2) I had an answer with a comment. I have converted this answer to a comment. The old comment was lost.
fields.summary: Comments are lost when converting an answer to a comment
